reviewText: The movie is wonderful movie, albeit an elicit affair, it still very well done with great acting by the leads. I had previously seen this movie several times via my streaming device, so I was well familiar with it.  That being said, this particular dvd's translation/subtitles/grammar were/are very poor.  Good thing I had seen it before or else it would literally would have been "lost in translation".  If you can find a better version, make it "a must see".  The movie is 5 star worthy, translation is barely a 2, if that.

If you understand Japanese this is a five-star movie because of the excellent production qualities.  If you need to rely on English captions, as I do, then the story is almost incomprehensible.  The English translation is very poor.  There's a version of this film that does have excellent captions, but this isn't it.

The story itself has been panned by other reviewers, but I enjoyed it because it calls into question what it means to love a woman.
One of my favorite movie watch on Netflix until they drop it or ether the service agreement expired. If you believe in love at first sight or if you don't; you need see this movie.
I like cars and I like airplanes. I also like thinking back over my life and wondering about the other roads.

A beautiful film; truly beautiful. One which says more than the dialog and film alone can convey. I find many Asian films far deeper, more realistic and meaningful than many Capra-esque western films. Personally, I have not found life to be as full of sweetness and light as most of the films made in Hollywood would have you believe. I suppose that's what I find attractive and admirable about Asian cinema. This film is a prime example.
